comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: There are two "t's" in Wurttemberg.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: There's also two dots on the ü... William II (German Wilhelm II) (25 February 1848 in Stuttgart – 2 October 1921 in Bebenhausen) was the fourth King of Württemberg, from 6 October 1891 until the abolition of the kingdom on 30 November 1918. He was the son of Prince Frederick of Württemberg (1808–1870) and his wife Princess Catherine Frederica of Württemberg (1821–1898), daughter of King William I of Württemberg (1781–1864); both parents were first cousins.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you both very much.  We'll do our best to make the corrections to the name the next time we update the record.
